articles.author: CHARLES M. BLOW
articles.title: You Have a Right to Weariness
articles.description: The struggle for goodness and decency is an eternal struggle, not a seasonal one.
articles.content: Do we have a right to weariness in an era of animus? More precisely, can we afford it, or is exhaustion a luxury reserved for those whose wealth, privilege and status insulate them from the losses the rest of us could suffer? Does patriotic defense of country… [+1162 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Asia Stocks Pressured on Global Growth Worries, Oil Woes
articles.description: Asian shares fell on Monday, extending weakness in global equity markets at the end of last week as soft Chinese economic data and falling oil prices rekindled anxiety about the outlook for world growth.
articles.content: That helped to lift oil prices, with U.S. crude rising 0.90 percent to $60.73 a barrel and Brent crude gaining 1.13 percent to $70.97 per barrel. However, the Saudi supply cut may prove to be a temporary solution to falling prices as global growth slows, with… [+851 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Britain's 'Broken' Audit Sector Must Change-MP
articles.description: Britain's parliament will start an inquiry into auditing in January to ensure that two pending reviews will lead to actual reform of a "broken" sector dominated by the Big Four accounting firms, a senior lawmaker said on Monday.
articles.content: LONDON Britain's parliament will start an inquiry into auditing in January to ensure that two pending reviews will lead to actual reform of a "broken" sector dominated by the Big Four accounting firms, a senior lawmaker said on Monday. Rachel Reeves, chair of… [+585 chars]

articles.author: HAMPTON SIDES
articles.title: Remembering the Forgotten War
articles.description: Korean war veterans Stan Fuji and James Kaleohano stand by flag-draped transfer cases with the remains of American soldiers repatriated from North Korea during a ceremony in August at Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam, Honolulu.
articles.content: Manning a weapon as lethal as this, Private Chapman knew it was only a matter of time before the Chinese found him. They shot him in the left arm, then the right leg, then the right arm. A medic treated his wounds, and Private Chapman climbed back on the truc… [+2165 chars]

articles.author: DAVID LEONHARDT
articles.title: Let the People Vote
articles.description: Voters waiting in a long line to vote in the 2018 midterm general election, outside a polling station located at Robious Middle School in Midlothian, Virginia.
articles.content: Amid last weeks mostly good news, Arkansas and North Carolina passed new voter-identification measures that are clearly intended to hold down African-American turnout. Most outrageously, top Republicans, including President Trump and Senator Marco Rubio, are … [+1588 chars]

articles.author: JACK NICAS, THOMAS FULLER and TIM ARANGO
articles.title: Forced Out by Deadly California Fires, Then Trapped in Traffic
articles.description: The infernos raging at both ends of California have created a double nightmare for residents. Many who fled fires found themselves stuck on traffic-clogged roads. Some died in their cars.
articles.content: The traffic continued as they made their way through Paradise. At times, they stalled in traffic as flames menaced and other motorists panicked and abandoned their vehicles to try to escape on foot. Propane tanks exploding around them added to the atmosphere … [+1447 chars]

articles.author: MARGARET RENKL
articles.title: How to Rake Leaves on a Windy Day
articles.description: After the elections, a red-state liberal ponders futility — and against all odds, arrives at hope.
articles.content: Dont let the wind become a frustration to you. This is not the time for insisting on perfection. We are making do now, remember? In a forest, fallen leaves compost themselves to feed the trees. The leaves you miss in raking will molder and rot through the win… [+1637 chars]

articles.author: HENG
articles.title: Not Down for the Count on China?
articles.description: President Trump’s sanctions may still be a threat.
articles.content: Despite Mr. Trump's beating in last weeks midterm elections, President Xi Xinping may not want to breathe a sigh of relief just yet, as the sanctions against China are seen by many as having broad support, perhaps even among the soon-to-be bluer U.S. House of… [+16 chars]
